Reviews.Title: “Nice Beachfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mswguitar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated Valentines Day on Saturday by leaving the kids with the grandparents and coming down to the beach. We will often just head down to PB and wing-it, finding a room that day (as opposed to booking in advance). My wife had stayed at the Beach Cottages in the past but this was my first time here. All in all, not a bad hotel if you're looking for a beach front property. This hotel is old and shows it's age, but our room was fine. It was quite small but since it was just the two of us, it worked out perfectly. It also wasn't too pricey but it was off-season, so I'm sure it would have been twice as much during the summer months. We got a room on the 3rd floor in the main building and the view was spectacular. We were able to park for free in the hotel parking lot (a definite plus in PB) and walk to wherever we wanted. Because of the location, price, parking, and the view, we will definitely consider staying here again, especially for off-season visits to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Lily53Ny
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past week at Beach Cottages in cottage 512..on the beach.. and we loved it there. We heard good things from family who have stayed there in the past. The sunsets were awesome. We really enjoyed watching the surfers and dolphins... Very very clean, the beds are comfortable and the kitchen had everything we needed. Just a quick walk to Ralph's and Trader Joe's for some goodies and we were settled in in no time. Housekeeping stops by every day to see if you need anything. My only regret is that we rented a car for a week which we hardly used at all. We enjoyed hanging at the beach and took many long walks. The weather was in the 70's every day (they say we lucked out) People at the desk were very nice and went above and beyond one day to assist our guests from LA with a parking issue. The restaurant next door was great. We enjoyed our stay so much and look forward to returning in the future. The sooner the better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beach Cottages Pacific Beach CA GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: taeweeee
Reviews.Content: We were not happy with the hotel that we booked so we drove over to Pacific Beach, CA to look for a beachside hotel. This was Thanksgiving week so I wasn't sure we would be able to find something. Beach Cottages was able to give us a great room with a ocean view for a good price. Comfy beds. We stayed in the room for 3 days then switched to a beach side cottage.(also a great price) We loved being able to step out of our room and have our feet in the sand. The nights were chilly by the beach, so the heater was welcome. Next time we will eat out less and make use of the large cottage kitchen. The staff was really helpful. They have books, puzzles and games in the lobby to use. Very relaxed and funky area. I loved having a Bloody Mary beachside next door at the Green Flash. Looking forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else in San Diego...”
Reviews.Author: Carey3709
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!! I first found this place when I stayed there while at a work conference in San Diego...and have been going back there ever since. One of the hardest things about the beaches in San Diego is parking....here you obviously get free parking because you are staying there. There are some great places to eat and shop along the boardwalk as well. The other great thing about this place is that they have differen levels of rooms. You can stay in the cottages right on the boardwalk or right behind it there are hotel/motel rooms depending on where you want to stay....no matter what, they were all clean and well managed. And no matter what type of room you stay in...you are close to the beach!!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: bncusa_99
Reviews.Content: we had been going there for 12 yr. but the price keep going up every yr. we were paying $86 per night now its $120. they do not offer senior discounts. but it is a nice place to stay. right on the beach. great place if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “BEST CHRISTMAS VACATION”
Reviews.Author: cactusbill23
Reviews.Content: My wife & I were thoroughly happy with our Beach Cottages experience during the week including Christmas 2010. Booked an oceanfront cabin (5 months prior). The view from our windows? Well, I would have to say it ranks in the top five - ever. Gorgeous Pacific Ocean sunsets. Magnificent swells curling through the Crystal Pier to the North. Early morning walks on the beautiful beach. Breakfast at "Konos" (outstanding value + fun spot). No stuffy "upscale" hotel atmospherics. Jus' friendly folks. I can understand why the rates more than double in the Summer. Even though the December chill prevented swimming (water and air both around 55), the gentle sounds of ocean waves was a definite plus to we desert dwellers. Highly recommend for people and families who appreciate simple, clean accomodations in a nearly perfect setting.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome as usual”
Reviews.Author: desertgirl217
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting the Ritz go somewhere else. But if you want a great fun location, clean rooms and old school California ambience, come here. We have been visiting for years and hesitate telling more people only because we want to keep it to ourselves. It is not fancy, no huge screen TVs, room service, etc. But what it does have is soul. You feel it the moment you arrive. Ping pong tables for the kids, outdoor grills for the whole family, laundry and walking distance to grocery stores (if your lucky enough to get a cabin that has a kitchen). And then, of course, there are clothing stores, surf shops and bike rentals if you are into that sort of thing. And then there is the beach and the boardwalk: directly in front of the place. Its busy and people watching central, so have fun with it! Make coffe in your room, or go get it at any of the number of really hip places around. Or pour some wine, then walk on the beach and let your cares melt away. All the while knowing your family is having fun too...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: tightwadmesa
Reviews.Content: The Beach Cottages is one of the best places to stay for families who want a San Diego beach vacation. We have stayed in both the cottages and motel rooms and have enjoyed both. Not having to fight for a parking space just to go to the beach is fantastic, the kids can run back to the room to use the restroom or get a snack, and, in the case of my husband, he can go back for a nap. A grocery store is nearby to pick up all the food you'll need for your stay. The Beach Cottages has several barbecues for grilling and patio tables to enjoy eating outside every night. If you're tired of the sand and water (but really, who would be?) they have ping pong and shuffleboard in the courtyard. Get your reservations in early in the year as they fill up fast.

Reviews.Title: “Always great to be back and relax”
Reviews.Author: canadian8675309
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been goin to the beach cottages for about 35 years, every year in July we always look forward to going, we have barbeques, play ping pong tournaments, go meet new people, as well go to SeaWorld and Belmont Park, which is a great local theme park. The service is great as well , and restaurants near by are great to eat, My favorite restaurant Konos just down the boardwalk near Crystal Pier and right next door is the Green Flash, great service. For anyone to relax and have fun at the beach I recommend going to the Beach Cottages

Reviews.Title: “Not a family friendly environment”
Reviews.Author: dqdennis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an older, refurbished building, with several off shoots to the main building. We had the misfortune of staying in an annex located in an alley surrounded by bars. It is a VERY busy and extremely noisey location. The room was older but large, slept 5 comfortably, but the beds were very hard and the carpet was filthy. The room had a nice size stocked kitchen with a bar and a large dining room table. There is no air conditioning, which I am very glad it was only in the high 60's cause it got pretty stuffy in the late afternoon, and you would not dare leave the sliding glass door open at night, as we were in an alley with all types of actvitiy, homeless people sleeping in the bushes, people smoking pot and lots of intoxicated individuals. The last night we had several people banging on our door at 3:30 in the am. The average age in this particular block was around 19 years old. It felt more like spring break in Rocky Point Mexico. On a positive note....the beach was just a very short block away, and you could see the waves from the balcany.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shoredude2
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights in a 3rd floor motel room that directly looked out onto the beach and cottage overtop the cottages. It was a superb view. The room was very nice although slightly on the small side. Some of the fixtures were older but still in good condition. The staff was very accomodating. The room had a refrigerator and microwave, and there is a Ralph's grocery store diaganally across the street. The beach out in front of the hotel and the neighborhood in general tends to draw a younger crowd. There is a place just down the ocean walk called Kono's that has a very good breakfast at a very good price (it also has a long line but is worth the wait). Overall very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty satisfied with location, of the two cottages we stayed in one was much better than the other”
Reviews.Author: grant458
Reviews.Content: We rented one of the ocean front, 2-bedroom cottages (#513) for 2 nights and then switched to a non-oceanfront cottage (#519) for our third night since the oceanfront wasn't available. The first cottage was much smaller and older (worn wooden floors, older refrigerator) but had a great view of the ocean out of the front window. The second cottage had nice tiled floors and a larger updated kitchen, a larger living room and much larger bedrooms. The ocean was still visible out the livingroom window. My husband and I were travelling with our two young children and my mother and the oceanfront cottage was a bit cramped even though it can accommodate 6. If I had known the difference in the size of the places I would have chose to stay in the non-oceanfront, 2-bedroom cottage because of the extra space. Both places had a great patio/seating area outside the front door and easy access to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beachside holiday”
Reviews.Author: Knottsy
Reviews.Content: We visited San Diego in March 2009 and absolutely loved the beach cottages. The four of us had 2 rooms in the 'motel / hotel' part as we learned that the cottages themselves get booked up around a year in advance (we can see why- they looked so cute!) The location is fantastic - right on the beautiful beach; the only downside is that San Diego had rain while we were there (and being British it is not what we expected - a taxi driver blamed us for bringing the weather with us!) and it was unfortunate that we did not get the sunshine, warm temperatures or sunsets we expected. The Beach Cottages are really laid back and fun and the rooms were large, clean and with good views to the ocean. We didn't have a car which was unfortunate although taxis were reasonably priced to Sea World and the Zoo and there were plenty of bars and restaurants near The Cottages to spend our evenings relaxing. We hope to visit San Diego again in the future - when it is sunny! - and would definitely ensure we booked up well in advance to try to stay in one of the actual cottages.

Reviews.Title: “best beach location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Emilygarriss
Reviews.Content: Right on the ocean. Park you car and enjoy the beach, dining right at your doorstep. We go back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Trust Me, Hot Rooms and Noise, Noise, Noise!”
Reviews.Author: friend2dogs
Reviews.Content: IF you're going to go here for the LOCATION, be sure you are not on the west side of the bldg. There are two restaurant/bars where people congregate even after closing. Car alarms going off, people yelling etc...Just when you think you can get some sleep, delivery and trash trucks start about 7:00 a.m. let's not forget the people who are rummaging for bottles and cans. All the while your slider is open because it's too hot and there is no air conditioners in the rooms. We Paid $160 a night. After taxes and fees it ended being $200 a night. The staff at the desk said they could move us to another room but it would cost us another $80. HUH??? Great location on the beach, but the hotel doesn't even have blowdryers in the rooms. Rooms are very basic and you are asked to wash your own dishes. I should have listened to the other review about the rooms being stuffy and hot.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean View Balcony, Walk right onto Beach, Great Price for Location”
Reviews.Author: HistoryNutCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Great find! Non-Smoking Property has little cottages and two buildings with motel rooms; we stayed in motel room on third floor. Delighted to find we had a room with a balcony (complete with chairs and small table) overlooking the beach, kitchen, and sitting area next to Queen bed. Extras: BBQs for guest use, ping pong tables, lots of decent-sized parking spots (rare in this area!), and gates leading straight out to the beach. Staff was very friendly and checked to be sure we knew how to find things in the neighborhood. We have stayed in the area before, and one of our favorite things is the great "four lane" walking/biking/skateboarding path that runs for a couple miles along the beachfront. You can watch the crashing waves as you get your exercise. Beach is great for laying out, playing volleyball, etc. We love the no smoking, no alcohol policy on the beach. Chain grocery, IHOP, and drug store a block away. Near delis, shops and lots of restaurants/food stands. Near Sea World. Only potential downside: This is an area with lots of beach foot traffic so there are a lot of people walking and bicycling by day and night. BUT we found that closing our sliding glass door closed out the sounds, too, when we were ready to turn in.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Beach Cottages”
Reviews.Author: TwinoneArizona
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 82 yr. old mother and 3 senior sisters in October. It was great!! It is certainly family oriented and the only complaint I had was the ice machine not working, BUT repaired the next day. The entire place is clean and comfortable and location is the best. The staff was helpful on check-in, but nobody around to assist with luggage, but the elevators were a nice surprise, so we didn't have the problems we expected. All in all it was a great experience and will be #1 on our choice for the San Diego beach area again. S. L. from Scottsdale, AZ

Reviews.Title: “No complaints and superb location!”
Reviews.Author: redstarlegend
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good place to stay for the price if you want to be close to the beach....and the bars! Me and my friends stayed in one of the apartment suites which was perfect for us, large room with plenty of space and included 2 queen size beds, a sofa bed and a kitchen. Although the apartments arent advertised as a sea view, we had a pretty decent view of the beach from our balcony, beach itself was beautiful and literally about 30 seconds walk away! Bathroom was fine, very clean and towels were changed every day, shower was great really powerful and hot! The beach cottages also provide free Wireless broadband which worked great. My only complaint about the place was the lack of air conditioning, we stayed in september which is one of the warmest months of the year and the room was very warm if you didnt have the doors wide open(which obviously you cant do at night!). In terms of nightlife this place is great, loads of bars/restaurants just minutes walk away and if you want to take a trip to downtown its only 10 mins or so in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Some Things to Consider ....”
Reviews.Author: nalahblueberry
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a motel room at The Beach Cottages, in Pacific Beach for five nights, and think I can answer some questions single travelers may be having about choosing this particular property for their getaway. First, and foremost, the view and location simply cannot be beat. Close to everything you need, and miles of boardwalk make this spot ideal for a beach vacation. With that being said, I wanted to report that as a single older woman traveler, you may want to rethink some things. My room faced the ocean, and was uncomfortably hot with no breeze. No A/C, I had a fan only. There were people behind me (second floor), so no cross ventilation was possible, hence a hot box of a room. Bottom line: Unless they have a better room, don't bother booking this cell, and it's no way appropriate for two people!! The front desk was sullen but efficient. Not a friendly place, and unless you bring your friends along, you'll likely not speak to anyone for days on end. But, again, this may be what you are after. The shower was great, and the micro and refrig looked brand new, so no worries, there. There were lots of families with preschoolers, and I would only stay here again if I was in a cottage in the front, with people, and there was a chance for a breeze via cross ventilation. Bottom line again: if this is the best you can afford, go for it. Just be ready to enjoy the view! P.S. The internet does not work, either. Nor does the ice maker.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: 4gaugesurprise
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that everyone has different expectations of their hotel experience. What I wanted was a clean room at a reasonable price ON THE BEACH. Not "near" the beach but I wanted to be right there. The Beach Cottages was the perfect place for my vacation style and budget. I stayed in the smallest/cheapest room in the main building. For $140/night the room was small but quite clean and adequate for my needs. The staff was polite and helpful and even went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. The best part is that I open my door and there is the beach!! Spent 2 nights on the second floor then had to move to the third floor (I booked way too late and had to take what was available) and I must say the view from the 3rd floor was as perfect, just look out over the beach. There are a few things about the Beach Cottages you need to be aware of to make sure this is the right place for you. First of all, there was NO air conditioning. I'm from AZ so the average temp on the beach is already cooler than I usually run my AC at so this was no issue. There is a relaxed community atmosphere at the Beach Cottages with a mix of young and old mixing and BBQing in the common areas. If you're looking for chilling out with others, getting a game of shuffleboard or cards or just hit some beer with your neighbors - this is your place. If you're used to being pampered by your hotel/spa - don't look here. Overall I loved the location, the service was great and the rooms were clean - all for what I thought was a REALLY great price to stay ON the beach. I'll be staying there every trip from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: jmiranda
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beach Cottages for a long weekend with my sisters. The 3 days we were there the weather was really hot!! So that made the stay even better. The hotel is clean the people at the front desk were very nice. plenty of resturants, bars, and stores around the area. Next time we go to San Diego will take the kids they would have a blast there!!! Would like to rent one of the little cottages next time. We all enjoyed are stay so will you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: DonnaSueShaw
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4-day stay at the Beach Cottages. We stayed in the two bedroom apartment which include a kitchen (my husband and I have 4 teenagers). The rooms were clean, staff was helpful (though we had few needs), and the proximity to the beach made for a perfect location. There price is right - there aren't a lot of "extras" like a pool, beach chairs, or beach towels, but there are stores all over within walking distance where you can buy whatever you need to compliment your stay. There are restuarants within walking distance as well (not to mention a super market for those of you who take advantage of the kitchen) and plenty of other things to do just a short drive away. I highly recommend this place if you are looking to stay on the beach and are on a budget - kids or no kids.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: aldoreit
Reviews.Content: Can not be beat for its location (right on the beach), rates are very reasonable, clean, and attentiive staff. Have stayed here twice in the last 3 years and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Room With a Killer View!”
Reviews.Author: flaguy
Reviews.Content: The view of the Pacific Ocean when you walk out your front door is the best thing about The Beach Cottages. I had a room on the third floor of the main building and was very pleased with my stay. The room was not large but the bed was comfortable and the housekeeper did a good job of cleaning and was very nice about checking to see if it was convenient for her to clean. It was very quiet in my room but I would be concerned about the north building as it overlooks some bars and noise might be a problem. There was a "kitchen area" with a refrigerator, micowave, coffee pot and sink and then a separate room with shower and toliet. It is an older property but everything was clean and well maintained. There was no air conditioning which was fine while I was there but might be a concern during warmer weather. You can open the window across the front (with screen) but you can't leave it open when you are not there or possibly at night as anyone could walk in. The front desk people were friendly and helpful and there are lots of eating places in easy walking distance. You have to try Kono's at the end of Garnet at the pier for breakfast (huge portions). I'll definitely be back to The Beach Cottages!

Reviews.Title: “A great place if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: Weltreisender77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Cottages on Oct of 2007 past the busy season. The Cottages have several wings and we stayed in the West Wing facing the street. We had a balcony with a partial ocean view which was nice. But every night until about 1am there were drunken colleege kids and surfers walking up and down the street screaming at the top of their lungs. Then at 7 in the morning the trucks that would smooth out the beach drove by. And shortly thereafter the delivery trucks would show up. So it was hard to get a good night's sleep. We slept with earplugs. Taking a nap during the days was also hard since it was never quiet. Unfortunately there were no rooms available that faced the inside. However the location next to the beach was excellent. There was a Ralphs very close by and there were barbecue pits on the property which made it possible to have some excellent meals without breaking the bank. So if you do go there get either a cottage, a 1 bedroom in the main building, or a room in the west wing facing south. Avoid the north building and the rooms in the west wing facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ak32
Reviews.Content: The Beach Cottages are AWESOME. I didn't stay in one of the cottages, but in a room on the third floor of the main building. We had a balcony with a beautiful view. It was spotlessly clean. I figured being right on the beach it would have a sandy, grimy feel, but it didn't. The cleaners even sweep and mop the sand off of the sidewalks. Our room had a sliding glass door that we could open and look right at the ocean from the comfort of the bed. It was awesome. The hotel is completely fenced in, with doors that open right to the beach. It's a great place for kids, with ping-pong and shuffle board and they can play on the property. It's within walking distance of many restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but rooms were too hot to enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Imaginaryfriend3
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Labor day weekend. I knew they didn't have air conditioning in the rooms but I thought they would of worked out a way to venelate the rooms better. They did supply the room with a plug-in fan but the rooms get very hot when the doors are all closed. They don't have a patio security screen door so you can't leave your patio door open and feel secure. The hallway was cooler than my room, maybe they should install venelation windows above the room entry doors (old school). I might stay here in the cooler months but doubt if I would stay here during the hot months again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great location, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: TrippinTwo
Reviews.Content: We have been staying here on and off for many years and can attest that it is the best place to stay in this area without breaking the bank. If you want to watch people, play on the beach, relax, play in the surf...well, this location can't be beat. The rooms are mostly clean and in good order, though I have seen some that were in serious need of upgrades -- especially in the main building. The furnshings are basic and have in the past been somewhat in need of repair, though this past February the room we got was fine. Our room came with a small but serviceable balcony. The bathroom was small but funtional (and very dated). The bed is OK, the linens OK. The building inside and out seems to be in decent repair. Parking is free. The location for downtown and other touristy S.D. attractions is just OK. If you're going to do those things it is probably best to have your own car. Nearby are numerous restaurants, most of which are poor to just OK. The staff is efficient if a little on the unprofessional and unhelpful side. But maybe that's the lazy beach town mentality creeping in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location & price”
Reviews.Author: mildbill
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the hotel rooms in the main building at The Beach Cottages. My room had a half-size refrigerator, microwave oven and a coffee maker. The room had been refurbished and the housekeeping staff was fairly attentive. Since it was low season (just before Thanksgiving), the facility was not crowded - a few small family groups (without children) and individuals and older couples just seeking peace and quiet. As others have noted, there is a north building that backs up to the alley to Joe's Crab Shack and a bar. I did not stay in that building; my comments do not apply to that building. On the second and third floors of the main building, the exterior breezeway also has seating areas outside the rooms. This is pleasant, but I could see that it could be a problem if the other guests are not considerate. If you have the sliding glass door open to catch the breeze, you may hear more of your neighbors' conversations than they intend for you to hear. I liked the location in Pacific Beach. As others have mentioned, the hotel is right on the boardwalk. Within a few blocks walk there are 2 bus lines that can take you to La Jolla, downtown San Diego, or the Old Town Transit center and trolley. I would look forward to staying here again in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: celicafan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beach Cottages for 4 nights on our honeymoon. Location was great, RIGHT on the beach. Very convienient to just sit on the beach and relax, drink a few beers and be able to run up to the room to use the washroom/etc. Great staff, didn't have any problems during the stay. A little surprised there was no air conditioning but it wasn't a problem (big ceiling fan and small fan in the room worked fine). Prime location, walking distance to everything around Pacific Beaches main strip. Lots of restaurants/bars/etc. Very affordable food close by if you like simple pub food. Other options for higher class food as well. Overall, really enjoyed our stay and couldn't have chosen a better hotel for the money (or even more money!) Tim

Reviews.Title: “Did not like”
Reviews.Author: BMS27
Reviews.Content: Our experience of the Beach Cottages is clearly not the same as other reviews so it must be because we were also on the block behind the crab restaurant...no sea view ..no view at all apart from the back of this building and its parking lot. We had just stayed in beautiful apts in LA and Vegas and had not prebooked a hotel in San Diego...we saw this in passing and booked in a hurry. Not saying it was terrible and the hotel receptionist did get us the quietest room on the block but the room was a little dark and depressing. Very spacious. It was fairly clean and kitchen was reasonably okay but looked a bit like a student flat. The balcony and stairways were a bit scruffy and dusty and cigarette butts on the floor and we had an ashtray full on our plastic table by the door. Had the location of Mission Beach been fabulous we would probably have stuck it out but checked out after one night. Def not worth $200 per night considering what we got for our money for the rest of holiday. Mission Bay is for youngsters and is loud and scruffy. Having said that this hotel is clearly very popular with seniors and families because many were booking for next year so maybe it is not as bad as we think but we were just in the wrong place at the wrong time. When checking out they asked if we wanted to pre book for next year and appeared shocked when we said no so it seems quite a lot of people must say yes. For us, La Jolla just up the coast was more suited and we had a fabulous cliff top apt overlooking the ocean for the same price. Okay hotel just not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Ocean Front Cottage”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1704
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one bedroom ocean front cottage for three nights from 16 - 19 April 2006. We chose it based on the previous reviews on Trip Advisor and the wish to stay by the ocean. We found the location was very accessable. There was ample parking in a private car park. It was a short drive to both Seaworld and the Zoo. The location is adjacent to the boardwalk and beach and the ocean front cottage could not have been nearer. The view from the windows and patio are was fantastic especially at sunset. Pacific Beach itself is a popular area particuarly with young people, it was quite lively but felt safe and was not noticably noisy. Within a five minute walk there was a good selection of resonably priced restaurants, cafes, bars and shops. The accomodation was very welcoming and appeared very family orientated with BBQ areas, table tennis and a laundrette. Our cottage consisted of a living room with dinning table, seperate kitchen with good facilities, seperate bedroom and bathroom with bath and shower. The accomodation was spacious, clean and comfortable. The decor may have been a bit dated for some peoples taste but we found it charming and homely. We found it a very special place to stay and would have liked to have spent longer if our touring scheduele had allowed. It's a teriffic find and we would highly recommend it to others and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: lilem12684
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Beach Cottages with three of my friends on the final leg of our trip to Southern CA. We stayed for three nights. The four of us shared an apartment with two queen beds and a kitchen for $135/night (winter rate). The room was very large, and included a sitting area with a couch, chair, and coffee table near the TV and a large dining table with 6 chairs, if I recall correctly. The kitchen was well-equipped with silverware, pots and pans, baking dishes, cups, plates, bowls, etc. There were two queen beds and a decent-sized, clean bathroom. All of the furniture was new-looking and well-kept. The studio apartments (where we stayed) and motel rooms are in the North Building, set apart from the main building where the bigger apartments and cottages are located. The apartments/motel rooms in the North building do not have a view of the ocean, but the rooms in the main building do. Although we didn't have a view of the ocean, this didn't bother us. We could still smell and hear the ocean from our room, and from our room we were only a few steps from the beach. The hotel's location was nice- lots to do in the area without having to drive. The hotel is a quick walk from the boardwalk and pier, lots of bars, shops, and restaurants. Ralph's (grocery store) is right across the street. In the area you can rent bikes, rollerblades, boogie boards, etc. for the day. The area felt relatively safe, though it did seem more of a place for college-aged adults and older than a place for small children and families. I think maybe Mission Beach is more of a family-oriented place... that's just the impression I got. The hotel staff was helpful. When our toilet got clogged, the desk staff sent a maintainence person right away. The room was cleaned each day, and they were happy to give us extra towels. Overall, the Beach Cottages exceeded my expectations as a beachfront motel. I'd definitely return, maybe for longer next time!

Reviews.Title: “The best place for the money in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Zoeygirl
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay where the action is and be right on the beach, the beach cottages are 100% perfect. My family stays at least once a year. We are in are 30's with 3 kids ages 15, 13 & 9. We usually take a room in the north apartment because of the price and the view. The apartment rooms are great for a good size family who is on a budget. There is a small kitchen in each room. We very rarely used it, but it was very nice to have. It's stocked with everything you need to make a decent meal if you want to eat in. While on vacation I do not cook, so there are tons of restaurants within walking distance. This is such a great place if you like to people watch. Lots and lots of people. The down side of this place is the bar on the corner. We love to go and have a couple of drinks, but if you are not a partier and go to bed at a decent time, you may be awaken by young kids leaving the bar after 1am. This was not a big deal for us, but someone else may not like it. I will not stay anywhere else when we are in San Diego. If you really want to experience the beach lifestyle, this is the place. If you are looking for 4 or 5 star places this would not be it. The decor is outdated, there is no pool but everything is clean and probably the one of the most affordable places to stay in Pacific Beach!!!! Definately a Must!!!

Reviews.Title: “It Got Better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Cottage 519, one of the few two bedroom cottages that is suitable for two couples. Cost was $230 US/night for four people, very reasonable in San Diego. Our two runners just loved the proximity to the clean beach and grassy park for their long morning runs. The two walkers were also happy with the area although we left it every afternoon for other hiking destinations, shopping, or tours. We all loved the many choices of places to eat near by (ex. The Mission for breakfast) or a ten minute drive away (ex Hash-a-Go-Go for great breakfasts). Our cottage was simple, clean, and airy. Our first impression of the area was that it was crazy and we wanted to leave the next day. Turns out that day was the best weekend beach day of their spring break. It calmed down after that and by the end of our time there, we were wishing we could stay one more night. Make your reservations well ahead if you want a two bedroom cottage. We'd go back to San Diego happily and we'd recommend this place to you as long as you don't want posh.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: chilipepper54
Reviews.Content: First of all the best feature of staying at The Beach Cottages was the location and the fact that we were RIGHT AT THE BEACH! Every day we only had to walk down a couple of flights of stairs (outside so we could see and hear the ocean beckoning us!) and up a short walkway and voila! we were at the beach. It seemed to be a very safe location. The parking was free and somewhat secured from the general public. Now the not so best features....cleanliness. When my daughter crawled into bed upon arrival (being ill) she found an over the counter pill in the sheets! Overlooking this, it appeared that our room had not had a real cleaning in several visits. The mattress had stains on the sides which were visible when the quilt was pulled back. However...........the fact that we were on the beach overshadowed the negatives and we were able to enjoy our stay. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a completely different experience at the Beach Cottages. It looks like a good place for families if you can get one of the beachfront cottages, however my boyfriend and I stayed in the building that looked over a parking lot. When we arrived there were a bunch of frat boys yelling at each other on their balcony, getting drunk. No big deal except this lasted for most of the afternoon and night. The staff wasn't overly nice, the room was pretty depressing and we had someone from the staff walk into our room twice without knocking. We're both laid back people so it wasn't that big of a deal but I was really disappointed after reading all of the good reviews and having a totally different experience. Since I often check this site before travelling I wouldn't want someone else to end up in my position.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The great view:”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been going to The Beach Cottages for the past ten years and would not think to go anyplace else, The beautifull ocean view is breathtaking. Weare always stay on the 3rd floor overlooking the ocean. Thia year we will be going back to celebrate my husband`s 80th birthday and our anniversay. The room are clean and confortable and the staff is very efficient and willing to help anyone. Thank you for letting me tell you my dealings with the Beach Cottages.

Reviews.Title: “ocean love”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the hotel facing the ocean on the second floor. Very Clean . No air-conditioning, but they did provide a fan. We had a refrigerator & microwave with coffee pot. We both loved it! Friendly People all around. Our stay was beautiful, a great memory. We would definitly go back. Also a wonderful family place. A good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: nitabita
Reviews.Content: The Beach Cottages are very nice. Me and 3 of my friends (ages 25-26) stayed at the Beach Cottages for 2 nights and didn't want to leave. We stayed in the North Building. You can walk to the boardwalk and the beach and you have easy access to the strip. The room was very spacious. The room feels more like an apartment than a hotel room. There's nothing bad that I can say about this hotel except that there's no A/C and we didn't find out until after we booked the room. But it was cool, b/c it didn't get hot while we were there (March 2004). The next time I go to San Diego, I'm DEFINITELY staying at the Beach Cottages.

Reviews.Title: “Love the cottages”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the beach cottages for 25 years, I love them now just as much as ever. They are my first choice in any vacation. My first was when I was approximately 13, with my parents. My last visit was my Honeymoon, my next will be taking my children to the Beach Cottages for their first Ocean Experience. Hope they never change.
